DataElement.preferredName: Observation Reuse Template Study Activity Repeat Quantity ISO21090.URG.INT.NONNEG.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An activity defined at a global library level whose intention is to obtain a result by observing, monitoring, measuring or otherwise qualitatively or quantitatively gathering data or information about one or more aspects of a study subject's or experimental unit's physiologic or psychologic state. EXAMPLE(S): blood chemistry panel, body mass index calculation, blood pressure measurement The number of times the activity occurs. NOTE(S): If the frequency is more than once a day, this is still interpreted per time, e.g. BID for 5 days = 10 repeats.

An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.
